result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam W Paff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Bond amount posted shall be applied.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam W Paff

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Def in person & by Atty John Scott Schiro.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered to Count 2,  Court dismissed Count 1 for read-in,  Court finds def guilty on Count 2 and enters judgment.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Def in person & by Atty John Scott Schiro.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant moves for bail modification.  Victim also appears and request to have the no contact provision removed, statements by counsel and State does not oppose modification.  Court denies bond modification.  Atty. Schiro request contact by telephone or in process of counseling, Court denies motion to modify bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Def in person & by Atty John Scott Schiro.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel's first appearance.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
15R 019963    Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #109428 on 9/29/15
No contact with LS or her residence

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State request cash bond posted continue.  Defendant may retain Atty. John Schiro.  Court continues $650.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
